description.message: The locale files that power the http://interpr.it/ website.
description.description: A description of the Interpr.it locale files.

name.description: The name of the Interpr.it locale pack uploaded to Interpr.it.

homepage_title.description: The header and title of the Interpr.it homepage.

homepage_about.message: Interpr.it is a collaborative tool for browser extension developers and bi-lingual extension users. Developers, $link_open$upload your extensions$link_close$; translators, use Interpr.it to make your favorite extensions available in your native language.

homepage_link_label.description: Text used for a link to the Interpr.it homepage.

upload_page_title.description: The title of the page where developers upload their extension to Interpr.it.

upload_page_link_label.description: Text used for a link to the upload page.

api_docs_page_title.description: The title of the page containing API documentation.

api_docs_page_header.description: The header of the page containing the API documentation for Interpr.it.

api_docs_page_summary.message: All API URLs are on the $url$ domain. You should include $api_key_link_open$your API key$api_key_link_end$ as a POST or GET parameter named $code_start$api_key$code_end$ on every request.

api_docs_page_contact.message: If you'd like to see more API methods made available, email $email_address$.

api_get_parameters_header.description: 'GET' is an HTTP method for passing data in a request to a server via the URL.

api_post_parameters_header.description: 'POST' is an HTTP method for passing data in a request to a server.

api_parameter_description.description: The format in which API parameters are listed on the documentation page.

api_parameter_description_extension_id.message: The ID of the extension, as seen in the URL of an extension's permalink page.

api_parameter_description_locale_code.message: The locale code of the translated message. (A list of valid locale codes is available in $link_start$Google's i18n documentation$link_end$.)

api_parameter_description_name.message: The name of the message being translated.

api_parameter_description_history_id.message: The ID of the history entry, as returned by $history_api_url$.
api_parameter_description_history_id.description: The technical description of the 'history_id' API parameter.

api_parameter_description_package.message:
A .zip file of your extension (or just its $locale_directory_name$ directory and $manifest_file_name$ file), as if it were uploaded via an HTML form. One way to achieve this is:
$code_example$
api_parameter_description_package.description: The technical description of the upload API method.

api_description_upload.message: Processes a zip file of your extension and saves any changes to your locales.
api_description_upload.description: The technical description of the upload API method.

api_description_download.message: Returns a .zip file of the latest locales directory for a given extension.

api_description_translate.message: Saves a translation of a message from an extension.

api_description_history.message: Returns a list of all of the changes to a message translation.
api_description_history.description: The technical description of the history API method.

api_description_revert.message: Revert a translated string to an earlier revision.

progress.description: A word or phrase used to describe how many of the extension's phrases have been translated.

files.description: The header used for a section listing all of the files in a particular locale.

header_developer_actions.description: The header to a list of actions that an extension developer can take on the extension permalink page.

header_translator_actions.description: The header to a list of actions that a translator can take on an extension locale page.

api_error_upload.message: An error occurred while uploading your file (code $error_code$)

api_error_upload_auth.message: You must be signed in to upload an extension.

api_error_upload_invalid_zip.message: The file you uploaded was not a valid zip file. Please check the file and try again.

api_error_upload_missing_file.message: Could not locate $filename$. Make sure it is in the root of the zip file you upload.

api_error_upload_invalid_manifest.message: The JSON in your manifest.json file was invalid.

api_error_upload_missing_default_locale.message: Your manifest.json did not specify a default locale.

api_error_upload_missing_version.message: Your manifest.json did not include a version number.

api_error_upload_missing_name.message: Your manifest.json did not include an extension name.

api_error_upload_missing_default_message.message: Could not locate your default locale's messages.json

api_error_upload_empty_default_messages.message: Your default locale did not contain any messages.

api_error_upload_missing_default_locale_.message: Could not locate the '$message_key$' message in your default locale.

api_error_default_locale_modification.message: Only the developer of an extension can change a message in the default locale.

api_error_message_not_in_default_locale.message: That message doesn't exist in the default locale.

api_error_noauth_translate.message: You must be logged in to translate.

api_error_missing_default_locale_message.message: The default locale is missing the message $message_name$.

footer_google_affiliation.message: Interpr.it is not officially affiliated with Google or Mozilla.

action_signin_to_upload.message: Sign in to upload your extension.

header_top_translators.description: The header of a list of usernames representing the users that have translated the most words.

translate_error_signin.message: You need to $link_start$sign in$link_end$ in order to help translate an extension.

save_changes_button.description: The text on a button the user clicks to save changes to a form.

text_no_results_for_query_and_locale.message: No results for $query$ for extensions needing translation to $locale_code$.

text_no_results_for_locale.message: No result for extensions needing translation to $locale_code$.

call_to_action_select.description: The text that is shown by default in a drop-down list.

upload_instructions_1.message: Upload an XPI (Mozilla) or a ZIP file (Chrome) of your extension directory, not a packaged CRX file.

upload_instructions_2.message: Interpr.it will automatically fill in any translations that have been previously completed for other extensions. For example, if a translator has already translated 'Thank you' into French for another extension, and your extension uses the phrase 'Thank you,' Interpr.it will automatically transfer that translation for you.

upload_instructions_3.message: You can also $link_open$upload an extension from the command line$link_close$.

api_error_noauth_reset_key.message: You must be logged in to reset your API key.

action_message_history.description: The title of a link that a user can click on to see any changes to a translated message over time.

action_revert.description: The text of a link a user would click on to revert a translated message back to a previous version.

column_header_message_version.description: The header of a column in a table that lists recent changes to a translated string.

column_header_changed_by.description: The header of a column that lists which user changed a translation.

terms_of_use_developers.message: By uploading your software to Interpr.it, you grant to Interpr.it a worldwide, royalty-free, perpetual, non-exclusive right and license to display, reproduce, modify, adapt, publish, distribute, promote, archive, translate, in whole or in part, meta-data about your software and the content intended to be localized.
terms_of_use_developers.description: The Interpr.it terms of use for a developer.

terms_of_use_translators.message: By contributing translations to software via Interpr.it, you are granting to Interpr.it and the software developer a worldwide, royalty-free, perpetual, non-exclusive right and license to display, reproduce, modify, adapt, publish, distribute, promote, archive, translate, in whole or in part, the translated content.
terms_of_use_translators.description: The Interpr.it terms of use for a translator.

member_page_title.description: The title of the page that show's a member's contributions to the site.

link_extension_homepage.description: The text that a user can click on on an extension's page to visit the extension's homepage (outside of interpr.it).

email_preference_header.description: The header of a section where the user can specify their email preferences. An example item in this section would be 'An extension that I've helped translate is updated.'

email_preference_extension_updates.message: An extension that I've helped translate is updated.
email_preference_extension_updates.description: An option in the 'Email me when...' section of a user's preferences page.

email_preference_locale_completed.message: A locale is completed for an extension that I uploaded.
email_preference_locale_completed.description: An option in the 'Email me when...' section of a user's preferences page.

email_preference_message_changed.message: A message I translated is changed by another member.
email_preference_message_changed.description: An option in the 'Email me when...' section of a user's preferences page.

email_preference_extension_created.description: An option in the 'Email me when...' section of a user's preferences page.

email_batch_description.message: You will receive at most one email per day with all of the previous day's events included.

email_notification_subject.description: The subject of an email sent to a user listing their recent activity.

email_notification_intro.message: Here are your latest Interpr.it activity notifications:

email_notification_locale_complete.description: The message sent when a locale is completed.

email_notification_message_changed.description: The message sent when one of a translator's contributions is modified by another user.

action_change_email_preferences.description: Text that a user can click on to view a form where the user can change his email notification settings.

action_send_feedback.description: Text that a user can click on to send feedback to the Interpr.it developers.

email_welcome_subject.description: The subject of the welcome email sent to new users.

email_welcome_text_1.message: Welcome to Interpr.it! You've joined the ranks of literally several other people who all use Interpr.it to manage their Chrome extension translations.
email_welcome_text_1.description: Text in the welcome email sent to new users.

email_welcome_text_2.message: Are you a developer? Log in to upload your extensions, or upload them from the command line using the $link_open$Interpr.it API$link_close$.
email_welcome_text_2.description: Text in the welcome email sent to new users.

email_welcome_text_3.message: Are you a translator? Visit $link_open$Interpr.it$link_close$ to search for extensions in need of translation.
email_welcome_text_3.description: Text in the welcome email sent to new users.

email_welcome_text_4.message: Questions? Comments? Concerns? Email $email_address$ with your feedback.
email_welcome_text_4.description: Text in the welcome email sent to new users.
